revision.text:
'''Los objetos de Oak''' son objetos especiales dados al jugador por el [[Professor Oak|Profesor Oak]] o comprados en tiendas durante el progreso del juego. Estos objetos funcionan como mejoras a la cuenta del jugador al ser equipados.
[[File:EmptyOak.png|right|No items selected]]
[[File:FullOak.png|right|Items fully selected]]
==Us0== Cada objeto de Oak mejora diferentes características en el juego, y y pueden mejorarse gracias al usarlos de forma contínua. Los jugadores empiezan con solo una ranura para activar los objetos de Oak. Al capturar más pokémon se van adquiriendo más ranuras. Son las siguientes: {|class="wikitable sortable" ! Slot !! Pokémon
necesarios |- | 1 || 20 |- | 2 || 50 |- | 3 || 100 |} ==Obtención== Los objetos de Oak se consiguen avanzando en el juego y capturando pokémons únicos, con las siguientes excepciones: [[Squirtbottle]], [[Sprinklotad]], [[Explosive Charge]], y el [[Treasure Scanner]],que pueden ser comprados en algunas ciudades determinadas. ==Lista de objetos== {|class="wikitable sortable" ! ! Nombre ! Pokémons únicos necesarios |- | {{Bag3|Magic Ball}} | [[Magic Ball]] | 20 |- | {{Bag3|Amulet Coin}} | [[Amulet Coin]] | 30 |- | {{Bag3|Rocky Helmet}} | [[Rocky Helmet]] | 40 |- | {{Bag3|EXP Share}} | [[EXP Share]] | 50 |- | [[File:Sprayduck_New.png|24px]] | [[Sprayduck]] | 60 |- | {{Bag3|Shiny Charm}} | [[Shiny Charm]] | 70 |- | {{Bag3|Blaze Cassette}} | [[Blaze Cassette]] | 80 |- | {{Bag3|Cell Battery}} | [[Cell Battery]] | 90 |- | [[File:Squirtbottle.png|24px]] | [[Squirtbottle]] | comprado en[[Towns & Cities#Johto|Goldenrod City]] por 5,000 {{farmpoints}} |- | [[File:Sprinklotad.png|24px]] | [[Sprinklotad]] | comprado en [[Towns & Cities#Hoenn|Mauville City]] por 10,000 {{farmpoints}} |- | [[File:ExplosiveCharge.png|24px]] | [[Explosive Charge]] | comprado en [[Towns & Cities#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]] por 5,000 {{Questpoints}} |- | [[File:TreasureScanner.png|24px]] | [[Treasure Scanner]] | comprado en [[Towns & Cities#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]] por 10,000 {{Questpoints}} |}
{{Oak items}}
[[Category:Oak Items]] [[Category:Items]]

Pokémons únicos necesarios |- | {{Bag3|Magic Ball}} | [[Magic Ball]] | 20 |- | {{Bag3|Amulet Coin}} | [[Amulet Coin]] | 30 |- | {{Bag3|Rocky Helmet}} | [[Rocky Helmet]] | 40 |- | {{Bag3|EXP Share}} | [[EXP Share]] | 50 |- | [[File:Sprayduck_New.png|24px]] | [[Sprayduck]] | 60 |- | {{Bag3|Shiny Charm}} | [[Shiny Charm]] | 70 |- | {{Bag3|Blaze Cassette}} | [[Blaze Cassette]] | 80 |- | {{Bag3|Cell Battery}} |..."

revision.text:
'''Los objetos de Oak''' son objetos especiales dados al jugador por el [[Professor Oak|Profesor Oak]] o comprados en tiendas durante el progreso del juego. Estos objetos funcionan como mejoras a la cuenta del jugador al ser equipados.
[[File:EmptyOak.png|right|No items selected]]
[[File:FullOak.png|right|Items fully selected]]
==Us0== Cada objeto de Oak mejora diferentes características en el juego, y y pueden mejorarse gracias al usarlos de forma contínua. Los jugadores empiezan con solo una ranura para activar los objetos de Oak. Al capturar más pokémon se van adquiriendo más ranuras. Son las siguientes: {|class="wikitable sortable" ! Slot !! Pokémon
necesarios |- | 1 || 20 |- | 2 || 50 |- | 3 || 100 |} ==Obtención== Los objetos de Oak se consiguen avanzando en el juego y capturando pokémons únicos, con las siguientes excepciones: [[Squirtbottle]], [[Sprinklotad]], [[Explosive Charge]], y el [[Treasure Scanner]],que pueden ser comprados en algunas ciudades determinadas.
==List of Items== {|class="wikitable sortable" ! ! Name ! Unique Pokémon Required |- | {{Bag3|Magic Ball}} | [[Magic Ball]] | 20 |- | {{Bag3|Amulet Coin}} | [[Amulet Coin]] | 30 |- | {{Bag3|Rocky Helmet}} | [[Rocky Helmet]] | 40 |- | {{Bag3|EXP Share}} | [[EXP Share]] | 50 |- | [[File:Sprayduck_New.png|24px]] | [[Sprayduck]] | 60 |- | {{Bag3|Shiny Charm}} | [[Shiny Charm]] | 70 |- | {{Bag3|Blaze Cassette}} | [[Blaze Cassette]] | 80 |- | {{Bag3|Cell Battery}} | [[Cell Battery]] | 90 |- | [[File:Squirtbottle.png|24px]] | [[Squirtbottle]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Johto|Goldenrod City]] for 5,000 {{farmpoints}} |- | [[File:Sprinklotad.png|24px]] | [[Sprinklotad]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Hoenn|Mauville City]] for 10,000 {{farmpoints}} |- | [[File:ExplosiveCharge.png|24px]] | [[Explosive Charge]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]] for 5,000 {{Questpoints}} |- | [[File:TreasureScanner.png|24px]] | [[Treasure Scanner]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]] for 10,000 {{Questpoints}} |}

revision.text:
'''Los objetos de Oak''' son objetos especiales dados al jugador por el [[Professor Oak|Profesor Oak]] o comprados en tiendas durante el progreso del juego. Estos objetos funcionan como mejoras a la cuenta del jugador al ser equipados.
[[File:EmptyOak.png|right|No items selected]]
[[File:FullOak.png|right|Items fully selected]]
==Us0== Cada objeto de Oak mejora diferentes características en el juego, y y pueden mejorarse gracias al usarlos de forma contínua. Los jugadores empiezan con solo una ranura para activar los objetos de Oak. Al capturar más pokémon se van adquiriendo más ranuras. Son las siguientes: {|class="wikitable sortable" ! Slot !! Pokémon
necesarios |- | 1 || 20 |- | 2 || 50 |- | 3 || 100 |}
==Acquisition== Oak Items are gained by playing through the game and capturing unique Pokémon, with the exception of the [[Squirtbottle]], [[Sprinklotad]], [[Explosive Charge]], and [[Treasure Scanner]], which can be bought from select cities.
==List of Items== {|class="wikitable sortable" ! ! Name ! Unique Pokémon Required |- | {{Bag3|Magic Ball}} | [[Magic Ball]] | 20 |- | {{Bag3|Amulet Coin}} | [[Amulet Coin]] | 30 |- | {{Bag3|Rocky Helmet}} | [[Rocky Helmet]] | 40 |- | {{Bag3|EXP Share}} | [[EXP Share]] | 50 |- | [[File:Sprayduck_New.png|24px]] | [[Sprayduck]] | 60 |- | {{Bag3|Shiny Charm}} | [[Shiny Charm]] | 70 |- | {{Bag3|Blaze Cassette}} | [[Blaze Cassette]] | 80 |- | {{Bag3|Cell Battery}} | [[Cell Battery]] | 90 |- | [[File:Squirtbottle.png|24px]] | [[Squirtbottle]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Johto|Goldenrod City]] for 5,000 {{farmpoints}} |- | [[File:Sprinklotad.png|24px]] | [[Sprinklotad]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Hoenn|Mauville City]] for 10,000 {{farmpoints}} |- | [[File:ExplosiveCharge.png|24px]] | [[Explosive Charge]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]] for 5,000 {{Questpoints}} |- | [[File:TreasureScanner.png|24px]] | [[Treasure Scanner]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]] for 10,000 {{Questpoints}} |}
{{Oak items}}

'''Los objetos de Oak''' son objetos especiales dados al jugador por [[Professor Oak]] o comprados en tiendas durante el progreso del juego. Estos objetos funcionan como mejoras a la cuenta del jugador al ser equipados.
[[File:EmptyOak.png|right|No items selected]]
[[File:FullOak.png|right|Items fully selected]]
==Us0== Cada objeto de Oak mejora diferentes características en el juego, y y pueden mejorarse gracias al usarlos de forma contínua. Los jugadores empiezan con solo una ranura para activar los objetos de Oak. Al capturar más pokémon se van adquiriendo más ranuras. Son las siguientes: {|class="wikitable sortable" ! Slot !! Pokémon

==Acquisition== Oak Items are gained by playing through the game and capturing unique Pokémon, with the exception of the [[Squirtbottle]], [[Sprinklotad]], [[Explosive Charge]], and [[Treasure Scanner]], which can be bought from select cities.
==List of Items== {|class="wikitable sortable" ! ! Name ! Unique Pokémon Required |- | {{Bag3|Magic Ball}} | [[Magic Ball]] | 20 |- | {{Bag3|Amulet Coin}} | [[Amulet Coin]] | 30 |- | {{Bag3|Rocky Helmet}} | [[Rocky Helmet]] | 40 |- | {{Bag3|EXP Share}} | [[EXP Share]] | 50 |- | [[File:Sprayduck_New.png|24px]] | [[Sprayduck]] | 60 |- | {{Bag3|Shiny Charm}} | [[Shiny Charm]] | 70 |- | {{Bag3|Blaze Cassette}} | [[Blaze Cassette]] | 80 |- | {{Bag3|Cell Battery}} | [[Cell Battery]] | 90 |- | [[File:Squirtbottle.png|24px]] | [[Squirtbottle]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Johto|Goldenrod City]] for 5,000 {{farmpoints}} |- | [[File:Sprinklotad.png|24px]] | [[Sprinklotad]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Hoenn|Mauville City]] for 10,000 {{farmpoints}} |- | [[File:ExplosiveCharge.png|24px]] | [[Explosive Charge]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]] for 5,000 {{Questpoints}} |- | [[File:TreasureScanner.png|24px]] | [[Treasure Scanner]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]] for 10,000 {{Questpoints}} |}

revision.text:
'''Los objetos de Oak''' son objetos especiales dados al jugador por [[Professor Oak]] o comprados en tiendas durante el progreso del juego. Estos objetos funcionan como mejoras a la cuenta del jugador al ser equipados.
[[File:EmptyOak.png|right|No items selected]]
[[File:FullOak.png|right|Items fully selected]]
==Usage== Each Oak Item buff different properties in game, and can be upgraded with constant use. Players start out with one slot that can be used to activate an Oak Item. As players catch more Pokémon, more slots are unlocked. They are as follows: {|class="wikitable sortable" ! Slot !! Pokémon
Required |- | 1 || 20 |- | 2 || 50 |- | 3 || 100 |}
==Acquisition== Oak Items are gained by playing through the game and capturing unique Pokémon, with the exception of the [[Squirtbottle]], [[Sprinklotad]], [[Explosive Charge]], and [[Treasure Scanner]], which can be bought from select cities.
==List of Items== {|class="wikitable sortable" ! ! Name ! Unique Pokémon Required |- | {{Bag3|Magic Ball}} | [[Magic Ball]] | 20 |- | {{Bag3|Amulet Coin}} | [[Amulet Coin]] | 30 |- | {{Bag3|Rocky Helmet}} | [[Rocky Helmet]] | 40 |- | {{Bag3|EXP Share}} | [[EXP Share]] | 50 |- | [[File:Sprayduck_New.png|24px]] | [[Sprayduck]] | 60 |- | {{Bag3|Shiny Charm}} | [[Shiny Charm]] | 70 |- | {{Bag3|Blaze Cassette}} | [[Blaze Cassette]] | 80 |- | {{Bag3|Cell Battery}} | [[Cell Battery]] | 90 |- | [[File:Squirtbottle.png|24px]] | [[Squirtbottle]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Johto|Goldenrod City]] for 5,000 {{farmpoints}} |- | [[File:Sprinklotad.png|24px]] | [[Sprinklotad]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Hoenn|Mauville City]] for 10,000 {{farmpoints}} |- | [[File:ExplosiveCharge.png|24px]] | [[Explosive Charge]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]] for 5,000 {{Questpoints}} |- | [[File:TreasureScanner.png|24px]] | [[Treasure Scanner]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]] for 10,000 {{Questpoints}} |}
{{Oak items}}
[[Category:Oak Items]] [[Category:Items]]

revision.text:
'''Oak Items''' are special items either given to the player by [[Professor Oak]] or purchasable from shops as they progress through the game. These items act as upgrades to the player's account when equipped.
[[File:EmptyOak.png|right|No items selected]]
[[File:FullOak.png|right|Items fully selected]]
==Usage== Each Oak Item buff different properties in game, and can be upgraded with constant use. Players start out with one slot that can be used to activate an Oak Item. As players catch more Pokémon, more slots are unlocked. They are as follows: {|class="wikitable sortable" ! Slot !! Pokémon
Required |- | 1 || 20 |- | 2 || 50 |- | 3 || 100 |}
==Acquisition== Oak Items are gained by playing through the game and capturing unique Pokémon, with the exception of the [[Squirtbottle]], [[Sprinklotad]], [[Explosive Charge]], and [[Treasure Scanner]], which can be bought from select cities.
==List of Items== {|class="wikitable sortable" ! ! Name ! Unique Pokémon Required |- | {{Bag3|Magic Ball}} | [[Magic Ball]] | 20 |- | {{Bag3|Amulet Coin}} | [[Amulet Coin]] | 30 |- | {{Bag3|Rocky Helmet}} | [[Rocky Helmet]] | 40 |- | {{Bag3|EXP Share}} | [[EXP Share]] | 50 |- | [[File:Sprayduck_New.png|24px]] | [[Sprayduck]] | 60 |- | {{Bag3|Shiny Charm}} | [[Shiny Charm]] | 70 |- | {{Bag3|Blaze Cassette}} | [[Blaze Cassette]] | 80 |- | {{Bag3|Cell Battery}} | [[Cell Battery]] | 90 |- | [[File:Squirtbottle.png|24px]] | [[Squirtbottle]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Johto|Goldenrod City]] for 5,000 {{farmpoints}} |- | [[File:Sprinklotad.png|24px]] | [[Sprinklotad]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Hoenn|Mauville City]] for 10,000 {{farmpoints}} |- | [[File:ExplosiveCharge.png|24px]] | [[Explosive Charge]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]] for 5,000 {{Questpoints}} |- | [[File:TreasureScanner.png|24px]] | [[Treasure Scanner]] | Bought at [[Towns & Cities#Kanto|Cinnabar Island]] for 10,000 {{Questpoints}} |}
{{Oak items}}
[[Category:Oak Items]] [[Category:Items]]
